other_tests.findings: Positive result for cytomegalovirus (CMV); reactive T. pallidum hemagglutination assay.
Showed a periosteal reaction in the right radius with small cystic lesions in the proximal humerus and abnormal bone quality.
Thoracic cage, spine, and pelvic bones appeared normal; however, areas of destruction were observed in the proximal shaft of the left humerus and the distal shaft of the right femur.
Thin corpus callosum, no intracranial hemorrhage or infarctions; gray-white matter differentiation was maintained. Ventricles, sulci, and basal cisterns were normal.

Normal cardiac segments with a small patent foramen ovale (PFO), normal valves, normal ventricular morphology, and an intact ventricular septum. Evidence of branch stenosis in the pulmonary arteries with a peak gradient of 28 mmHg.
